p: We examine the distribution of ME CRB estimates across bird and mammal species to assess evidence for a metabolic constraint. We assessed skewness and kurtosis of the ME CRB distribution using the skewness metric and D'Agnostino skewness test and Geary metric and Bonett‐Seier test in the R moments package. We tested for unimodality in the distributions using Hartigans’ dip statistic in the R diptest package. To test whether ME CRB varies systematically with T min or T max, we constructed null models for ME CRB by randomizing T min or T max among species and calculating the median and mean ME CRB values. We repeated the randomization 1,000 times.
